1 /*!
  2  * Hasher <http://github.com/millermedeiros/Hasher>
  3  * Includes: MM.EventDispatcher (0.8.2), MM.queryUtils (0.8.2), MM.event-listenerFacade (0.3)
  4  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
  5  * @version 0.9.7 (2010/11/01)
  6  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
  7  */
  8 /*
  9  * Miller Medeiros JS Library
 10  * @author Miller Medeiros
 11  * @version 0.1 (2010/09/10)
 12  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
 13  */
 14  
 15  /**
 16  * @namespace Miller Medeiros Namespace
 17  */
 18  var millermedeiros = {};
 19 /**
 20  * EventDispatcher Object, used to allow Custom Objects to dispatch events.
 21  * @constructor
 22  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
 23  * @version 0.8.2 (2010/08/26)
 24  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
 25  */
 26 millermedeiros.EventDispatcher = function(){
 27 	/** 
 28 	 * Event Handlers
 29 	 * @type Object.<string, Array.<Function>>
 30 	 */
 31 	this._handlers = {};
 32 	
 33 	/**
 34 	 * Disabled Event Types (events types that shouldn't be dispatched)
 35 	 * @type Array.<string>
 36 	 */
 37 	this._disabled = [];
 38 };
 39 
 40 millermedeiros.EventDispatcher.prototype = {
 41 	
 42 	/**
 43 	 * Add Event Listener
 44 	 * @param {string} eType	Event Type.
 45 	 * @param {Function} fn	Event Handler.
 46 	 */
 47 	addEventListener : function(eType, fn){
 48 		if(typeof this._handlers[eType] == 'undefined'){
 49 			this._handlers[eType] = [];
 50 		}
 51 		this._handlers[eType].push(fn);
 52 	},
 53 	
 54 	/**
 55 	 * Remove Event Listener
 56 	 * @param {string} eType	Event Type.
 57 	 * @param {Function} fn	Event Handler.
 58 	 */
 59 	removeEventListener : function(eType, fn){
 60 		if(! this.hasEventListener(eType)){
 61 			return;
 62 		}
 63 		var	typeHandlers = this._handlers[eType], //stored for performance
 64 			n = typeHandlers.length;
 65 		if(n == 1){
 66 			delete this._handlers[eType];
 67 		}else{
 68 			while(n--){ //faster than for
 69 				if(typeHandlers[n] == fn){
 70 					typeHandlers.splice(n, 1);
 71 					break;
 72 				}
 73 			}
 74 		}
 75 	},
 76 	
 77 	/**
 78 	 * Removes all Listeners from the EventDispatcher object.
 79 	 * @param {(string|boolean)} eType	Event type or `true` if want to remove listeners of all event types.
 80 	 */
 81 	removeAllEventListeners : function(eType){
 82 		if(typeof eType === 'string' && this.hasEventListener(eType)){
 83 			delete this._handlers[eType];
 84 		}else if(eType){
 85 			this._handlers = {};
 86 		}
 87 	},
 88 	
 89 	/**
 90 	 * Checks if the EventDispatcher has any listeners registered for a specific type of event. 
 91 	 * @param {string} eType	Event Type.
 92 	 * @return {boolean}
 93 	 */
 94 	hasEventListener : function(eType){
 95 		return (typeof this._handlers[eType] != 'undefined');
 96 	},
 97 
 98 	/**
 99 	 * Dispatch Event
100 	 * - Call all Handlers Listening to the Event.
101 	 * @param {(Object|string)} evt	Custom Event Object (property `type` is required) or String with Event type.
102 	 * @return {boolean} If Event was successfully dispatched.
103 	 */
104 	dispatchEvent : function(evt){
105 		evt = (typeof evt == 'string')? {type: evt} : evt; //create Object if not an Object to always call handlers with same type of argument.
106 		if(this.hasEventListener(evt.type)){
107 			var typeHandlers = this._handlers[evt.type], //stored for performance
108 				curHandler,
109 				i,
110 				n = typeHandlers.length;
111 			evt.target = evt.target || this; //ensure Event.target exists
112 			for(i=0; i<n; i++){
113 				curHandler = typeHandlers[i];
114 				curHandler(evt);
115 			}
116 			return true;
117 		}
118 		return false;
119 	},
120 	
121 	/**
122 	 * Check if Event will be dispatched (i.e. If event type is enabled)
123 	 * @param {string} evtType	Event type.	
124 	 * @return {boolean} If Event will be dispatched.
125 	 */
126 	willDispatch : function(evtType){
127 		var n = this._disabled.length;
128 		while(n--){
129 			if(this._disabled[n] === evtType){
130 				return false;
131 			}
132 		}
133 		return true;
134 	},
135 	
136 	/**
137 	 * Disable Event dispatching by type
138 	 * @param {...string} evtTypes	Event types that should be disabled (events types that shouldn't be dispatched)
139 	 */
140 	disableEvent : function(evtTypes){
141 		var types = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments, 0),
142 			n = types.length,
143 			curType;
144 		while(n--){
145 			curType = types[n];
146 			if(this.willDispatch(curType)){ //avoid adding multiple times
147 				this._disabled.push(curType);
148 			}
149 		}
150 	},
151 	
152 	/**
153 	 * Enable Event dispatching by type
154 	 * @param {...string} evtTypes	Event types that should be enabled (events types that should be dispatched)
155 	 */
156 	enableEvent : function(evtTypes){
157 		var types = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments, 0),
158 			n = types.length,
159 			m,
160 			curType;
161 		while(n--){
162 			curType = types[n];
163 			m = this._disabled.length;
164 			while(m--){
165 				if(this._disabled[m] === curType){
166 					this._disabled.splice(m, 1);
167 				}
168 			}
169 		}
170 	}
171 	
172 };
173 /**
174  * @namespace Utilities for query string manipulation.
175  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
176  * @version 0.8.2 (2010/08/12)
177  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
178  */
179 millermedeiros.queryUtils = {
180 	
181 	/**
182 	 * Gets full query as string with all special chars decoded.
183 	 * @param {string} [url]	 URL to be parsed, defaults to `location.href`
184 	 * @return {string}	Query string
185 	 */
186 	getQueryString : function(url){
187 		url = url || location.href; //used location.href to avoid bug on IE6 and pseudo query string inside location.hash
188 		url = url.replace(/#[\w\W]*/, ''); //removes hash (to avoid getting hash query)
189 		var queryString = /\?[a-zA-Z0-9\=\&\%\$\-\_\.\+\!\*\'\(\)\,]+/.exec(url); //valid chars according to: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1738.txt
190 		return (queryString)? decodeURIComponent(queryString[0]) : '';
191 	},
192 	
193 	/**
194 	 * Gets query as Object.
195 	 * - Alias for `millermedeiros.queryUtils.toQueryObject( millermedeiros.queryUtils.getQueryString(url) )`
196 	 * @param {string} [url]	URL to be parsed, default to location.href.
197 	 * @return {Object.<string, (string|number)>}	Object with all the query "params => values" pairs.
198 	 */
199 	getQueryObject : function(url){
200 		return this.toQueryObject(this.getQueryString(url));
201 	},
202 	
203 	/**
204 	 * Convert Query String into an Object
205 	 * @param {string} queryString	 Query String to be parsed
206 	 * @return {Object.<string, (string|number)>}	Object with all the query "params => values" pairs.
207 	 */
208 	toQueryObject : function(queryString){
209 		var queryArr = queryString.replace('?', '').split('&'), 
210 			n = queryArr.length,
211 			queryObj = {},
212 			value;
213 		while (n--) {
214 			queryArr[n] = queryArr[n].split('=');
215 			value = queryArr[n][1];
216 			queryObj[queryArr[n][0]] = isNaN(value)? value : parseFloat(value);
217 		}
218 		return queryObj;
219 	},
220 	
221 	/**
222 	 * Get query parameter value.
223 	 * @param {string} param	Parameter name.
224 	 * @param {string} [url]	URL to be parsed, default to location.href
225 	 * @return {(string|number)}	Parameter value.
226 	 */
227 	getParamValue : function(param, url){
228 		url = url || location.href;
229 		var regexp = new RegExp('(\\?|&)'+ param + '=([^&]*)'), //matches `?param=value` or `¶m=value`, value = $2
230 			result = regexp.exec(url),
231 			value = (result && result[2])? result[2] : null;
232 		return isNaN(value)? value : parseFloat(value);
233 	},
234 	
235 	/**
236 	 * Checks if query contains parameter.
237 	 * @param {string} param	Parameter name.
238 	 * @param {string} [url]	URL to be parsed, default to location.href
239 	 * @return {boolean} If parameter exist.
240 	 */
241 	hasParam : function(param, url){
242 		var regexp = new RegExp('(\\?|&)'+ param +'=', 'g'); //matches `?param=` or `¶m=`
243 		return regexp.test(this.getQueryString(url));
244 	},
245 	
246 	/**
247 	 * Converts object into query string.
248 	 * @param {Object} obj	Object with "params => values" pairs.
249 	 * @return {string}	Formated query string starting with '?'.
250 	 */
251 	toQueryString : function(obj){
252 		var query = [],
253 			param;
254 		for(param in obj){
255 			if(obj.hasOwnProperty(param)){ //avoid copying properties from the prototype
256 				query.push(param +'='+ obj[param]);
257 			}
258 		}
259 		return (query.length)? '?'+ query.join('&') : '';
260 	}
261 	
262 };
263 /*
264  * millermedeiros.event - DOM Event Listener Facade
265  * - Cross-browser DOM Event Listener attachment/detachment.
266  * - Based on Peter-Paul Koch addEventSimple <http://www.quirksmode.org/js/eventSimple.html>
267  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
268  * @version 0.3 (2010/06/23)
269  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
270  */
271 
272 /**
273  * @namespace Utilities for Browser Native Events
274  */
275 millermedeiros.event = millermedeiros.event || {};
276 
277 /**
278 * Adds DOM Event Listener
279 * @param {Element} elm Element.
280 * @param {string} eType Event type.
281 * @param {Function} fn Listener function.
282 */
283 millermedeiros.event.addListener = function(elm, eType, fn){
284 	if(elm.addEventListener){
285 		elm.addEventListener(eType, fn, false);
286 	}else if(elm.attachEvent){
287 		elm.attachEvent('on' + eType, fn);
288 	}else{
289 		elm['on' + eType] = fn;
290 	}
291 };
292 
293 /**
294 * Removes DOM Event Listener
295 * @param {Element} elm Element.
296 * @param {string} eType Event type.
297 * @param {Function} fn Listener function.
298 */
299 millermedeiros.event.removeListener = function(elm, eType, fn){
300 	if(elm.removeEventListener){
301 		elm.removeEventListener(eType, fn, false);
302 	}else if(elm.detachEvent){
303 		elm.detachEvent('on' + eType, fn);
304 	}else{
305 		elm['on' + eType] = null;
306 	}
307 };
308 /*
309  * Hasher Event
310  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
311  * @version 0.2 (2010/04/18)
312  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
313  */
314 
315 /**
316  * HasherEvent Object.
317  * <p>According to the HTML5 spec `hashchange` event should have `oldURL` and `newURL` properties, since the only portion of the URL that changes is the hash I decided to use `oldHash` and `newHash` instead. (http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/history.html#event-hashchange)</p>
318  * @param {string} eType	Hasher Event type.
319  * @param {(string|null)} oldHash	Previous Hash.
320  * @param {(string|null)} newHash	Current Hash.
321  * @constructor
322  */
323 var HasherEvent = function(eType, oldHash, newHash){
324 	/**
325 	 * Event Type
326 	 * @type string
327 	 */
328 	this.type = eType;
329 	/**
330 	 * Previous Hash value
331 	 * @type (string|null)
332 	 */
333 	this.oldHash = oldHash;
334 	/**
335 	 * Current Hash value
336 	 * @type (string|null)
337 	 */
338 	this.newHash = newHash;
339 };
340 
341 /**
342  * Returns string representation of the HasherEvent
343  * @return {string} A string representation of the object.
344  */
345 HasherEvent.prototype.toString = function(){
346 	return '[HasherEvent type="'+ this.type +'" oldHash="'+ this.oldHash +'" newHash="'+ this.newHash +'"]';
347 };
348 
349 //-- Constants --//
350 
351 /**
352  * Defines the value of the type property of an change event object.
353  * @type string
354  * @constant
355  */
356 HasherEvent.CHANGE = 'change';
357 
358  /**
359  * Defines the value of the type property of an init event object.
360  * @type string
361  * @constant
362  */
363 HasherEvent.INIT = 'init';
364 
365 /**
366  * Defines the value of the type property of an stop event object.
367  * @type string
368  * @constant
369  */
370 HasherEvent.STOP = 'stop';
371 /*
372  * Hasher
373  * - History Manager for rich-media applications.
374  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
375  * @version 0.9.6 (2010/11/01)
376  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
377  */
378 (function(window, document, location, history){
379 	
380 	
381 	//== Private Vars ==//
382 	
383 	var 
384 		/** @private {string} previous/current hash value */
385 		_hash, 
386 		
387 		/** @private {number} stores setInterval reference (used to check if hash changed on non-standard browsers) */
388 		_checkInterval,
389 		
390 		/** @private {boolean} If Hasher is active and should listen/dispatch changes on the window location hash */
391 		_isActive,
392 		
393 		/** @private {Element} iframe used for IE <= 7 */
394 		_frame,
395 		
396 		/** @private {string} User Agent */
397 		UA = navigator.userAgent,
398 		
399 		/** @private {boolean} if is IE */
400 		_isIE = /MSIE/.test(UA)  && (!window.opera),
401 		
402 		/** @private {boolean} If browser supports the `hashchange` event - FF3.6+, IE8+, Chrome 5+, Safari 5+ */
403 		_isHashChangeSupported = ('onhashchange' in window),
404 		
405 		/** @private {boolean} if is IE <= 7 */
406 		_isLegacyIE = /MSIE (6|7)/.test(UA) && !_isHashChangeSupported, //check if is IE6-7 since hash change is only supported on IE8+ and changing hash value on IE6-7 doesn't generate history record.
407 		
408 		/** @private {boolean} If it is a local file */
409 		_isLocal = (location.protocol === 'file:'),
410 		
411 		//-- local storage for performance improvement and better compression --//
412 		
413 		/** @private {millermedeiros} Miller Medeiros Namespace */
414 		mm = millermedeiros,
415 		
416 		/** @private {millermedeiros.EventDispatcher} @extends millermedeiros.EventDispatcher */
417 		Hasher = new mm.EventDispatcher(),
418 		
419 		/** @private {millermedeiros.queryUtils} Utilities for query string manipulation */
420 		_queryUtils = mm.queryUtils,
421 		
422 		/** @private {millermedeiros.event} Browser native events facade */
423 		_eventFacade = mm.event;
424 		
425 	
426 	//== Private Methods ==//
427 	
428 	/**
429 	 * Remove `Hasher.prependHash` and `Hasher.appendHash` from hashValue
430 	 * @param {string} hash	Hash value
431 	 * @private
432 	 */
433 	function _trimHash(hash){
434 		var regexp = new RegExp('^\\'+ Hasher.prependHash +'|\\'+ Hasher.appendHash +'$', 'g'); //match appendHash and prependHash
435 		return hash.replace(regexp, '');
436 	}
437 	
438 	/**
439 	 * Get hash value stored inside iframe
440 	 * - used for IE <= 7. [HACK] 
441 	 * @return {string}	Hash value without '#'.
442 	 * @private
443 	 */
444 	function _getFrameHash(){
445 		return (_frame)? _frame.contentWindow.frameHash : null;
446 	}
447 	
448 	/**
449 	 * Update iframe content, generating a history record and saving current hash/title on IE <= 7. [HACK]
450 	 * - based on Really Simple History, SWFAddress and YUI.history solutions.
451 	 * @param {(string|null)} hashValue	Hash value without '#'.
452 	 * @private
453 	 */
454 	function _updateFrame(hashValue){
455 		if(_frame && hashValue != _getFrameHash()){
456 			var frameDoc = _frame.contentWindow.document;
457 			frameDoc.open();
458 			frameDoc.write('<html><head><title>' + Hasher.getTitle() + '</title><script type="text/javascript">var frameHash="' + hashValue + '";</script></head><body> </body></html>'); //stores current hash inside iframe.
459 			frameDoc.close();
460 		}
461 	}
462 	
463 	/**
464 	 * Stores new hash value and dispatch `HasherEvent.CHANGE` if Hasher is "active".
465 	 * @param {string} newHash	New Hash Value.
466 	 * @private
467 	 */
468 	function _registerChange(newHash){
469 		newHash = decodeURIComponent(newHash); //fix IE8 while offline
470 		if(_hash != newHash){
471 			var oldHash = _hash;
472 			_hash = newHash; //should come before event dispatch to make sure user can get proper value inside event handler
473 			if(_isLegacyIE){
474 				_updateFrame(newHash);
475 			}
476 			Hasher.dispatchEvent(new HasherEvent(HasherEvent.CHANGE, _trimHash(oldHash), _trimHash(newHash)));
477 		}
478 	}
479 	
480 	/**
481 	 * Creates iframe used to record history state on IE <= 7. [HACK]
482 	 * @private
483 	 */
484 	function _createFrame(){
485 		_frame = document.createElement('iframe');
486 		_frame.src = 'about:blank';
487 		_frame.style.display = 'none';
488 		document.body.appendChild(_frame);
489 	}
490 	
491 	/**
492 	 * Get hash value from current URL
493 	 * @return {string}	Hash value without '#'.
494 	 * @private
495 	 */
496 	function _getWindowHash(){
497 		//parsed full URL instead of getting location.hash because Firefox decode hash value (and all the other browsers don't)
498 		//also because of IE8 bug with hash query in local file [issue #6]
499 		var result = /#(.*)$/.exec( Hasher.getURL() );
500 		return (result && result[1])? decodeURIComponent(result[1]) : '';
501 	}
502 	
503 	/**
504 	 * Checks if hash/history state has changed and dispatch HasherEvent.
505 	 * @private
506 	 */
507 	function _checkHistory(){
508 		var curHash = _getWindowHash();
509 		if(curHash != _hash){
510 			_registerChange(curHash);
511 		}
512 	}
513 	
514 	/**
515 	 * Check if browser history state has changed on IE <= 7. [HACK]
516 	 * - used since IE 6,7 doesn't generates new history record on hashchange.
517 	 * @private
518 	 */
519 	function _checkHistoryLegacyIE(){
520 		var windowHash = _getWindowHash(),
521 			frameHash = _getFrameHash();
522 		if(frameHash != _hash && frameHash != windowHash){ //detect changes made pressing browser history buttons. Workaround since history.back() and history.forward() doesn't update hash value on IE6/7 but updates content of the iframe.
523 			Hasher.setHash(frameHash);
524 		}else if(windowHash != _hash){ //detect if hash changed (manually or using setHash)
525 			_registerChange(windowHash);
526 		}
527 	}
528 	
529 	
530 	//== Public (API) ==//
531 	
532 	/**
533 	 * Hasher
534 	 * @namespace History Manager for rich-media applications.
535 	 * @extends millermedeiros.EventDispatcher
536 	 */
537 	this.Hasher = Hasher; //register Hasher to the global scope
538 	
539 	/**
540 	 * Hasher Version Number
541 	 * @type string
542 	 * @const
543 	 */
544 	Hasher.VERSION = '0.9.7';
545 	
546 	/**
547 	 * String that should always be added to the end of Hash value.
548 	 * <ul>
549 	 * <li>default value: '/';</li>
550 	 * <li>will be automatically removed from `Hasher.getHash()`</li>
551 	 * <li>avoid conflicts with elements that contain ID equal to hash value;</li>
552 	 * </ul>
553 	 * @type string
554 	 */
555 	Hasher.appendHash = '/';
556 	
557 	/**
558 	 * String that should always be added to the beginning of Hash value.
559 	 * <ul>
560 	 * <li>default value: '/';</li>
561 	 * <li>will be automatically removed from `Hasher.getHash()`</li>
562 	 * <li>avoid conflicts with elements that contain ID equal to hash value;</li>
563 	 * </ul>
564 	 * @type string
565 	 */
566 	Hasher.prependHash = '/';
567 	
568 	/**
569 	 * String used to split hash paths; used by `Hasher.getHashAsArray()` to split paths.
570 	 * <ul>
571 	 * <li>default value: '/';</li>
572 	 * </ul>
573 	 * @type string
574 	 */
575 	Hasher.separator = '/';
576 	
577 	/**
578 	 * Start listening/dispatching changes in the hash/history.
579 	 */
580 	Hasher.init = function(){
581 		if(_isActive){
582 			return;
583 		}
584 		
585 		var oldHash = _hash;
586 		_hash = _getWindowHash();
587 		
588 		//thought about branching/overloading Hasher.init() to avoid checking multiple times but don't think worth doing it since it probably won't be called multiple times. [?] 
589 		if(_isHashChangeSupported){
590 			_eventFacade.addListener(window, 'hashchange', _checkHistory);
591 		}else { 
592 			if(_isLegacyIE){
593 				if(!_frame){
594 					_createFrame();
595 					_updateFrame(_hash);
596 				}
597 				_checkInterval = setInterval(_checkHistoryLegacyIE, 25);
598 			}else{
599 				_checkInterval = setInterval(_checkHistory, 25);
600 			}
601 		}
602 		
603 		_isActive = true;
604 		this.dispatchEvent(new HasherEvent(HasherEvent.INIT, oldHash, _hash));
605 	};
606 	
607 	/**
608 	 * Stop listening/dispatching changes in the hash/history.
609 	 */
610 	Hasher.stop = function(){
611 		if(!_isActive){
612 			return;
613 		}
614 		
615 		if(_isHashChangeSupported){
616 			_eventFacade.removeListener(window, 'hashchange', _checkHistory);
617 		}else{
618 			clearInterval(_checkInterval);
619 			_checkInterval = null;
620 		}
621 		
622 		_isActive = false;
623 		this.dispatchEvent(new HasherEvent(HasherEvent.STOP, _hash, _hash)); //since it didn't changed oldHash and newHash should be the same. [?]
624 	};
625 	
626 	/**
627 	 * Retrieve full URL.
628 	 * @return {string}	Full URL.
629 	 */
630 	Hasher.getURL = function(){
631 		return location.href;
632 	};
633 	
634 	/**
635 	 * Retrieve URL without query string and hash.
636 	 * @return {string}	Base URL.
637 	 */
638 	Hasher.getBaseURL = function(){
639 		return this.getURL().replace(/(\?.*)|(\#.*)/, ''); //removes everything after '?' and/or '#'
640 	};
641 	
642 	/**
643 	 * Set Hash value.
644 	 * @param {string} value	Hash value without '#'.
645 	 */
646 	Hasher.setHash = function(value){
647 		value = (value)? this.prependHash + value.replace(/^\#/, '') + this.appendHash : value; //removes '#' from the beginning of string and append/prepend default values.
648 		if(value != _hash){
649 			_registerChange(value); //avoid breaking the application if for some reason `location.hash` don't change
650 			if(_isIE && _isLocal){
651 				value = value.replace(/\?/, '%3F'); //fix IE8 local file bug [issue #6]
652 			}
653 			location.hash = '#'+ encodeURI(value); //used encodeURI instead of encodeURIComponent to preserve '?', '/', '#'. Fixes Safari bug [issue #8]
654 		}
655 	};
656 	
657 	/**
658 	 * Return hash value as String.
659 	 * @return {string}	Hash value without '#'.
660 	 */
661 	Hasher.getHash = function(){
662 		//didn't used actual value of the `location.hash` to avoid breaking the application in case `location.hash` isn't available and also because value should always be synched.
663 		return _trimHash(_hash);
664 	};
665 	
666 	/**
667 	 * Return hash value as Array.	
668 	 * @return {Array.<string>}	Hash splitted into an Array.  
669 	 */
670 	Hasher.getHashAsArray = function(){
671 		return this.getHash().split(this.separator);
672 	};
673 	
674 	/**
675 	 * Get Query portion of the Hash as a String
676 	 * - alias to: `millermedeiros.queryUtils.getQueryString( Hasher.getHash() ).substr(1);`
677 	 * @return {string}	Hash Query without '?'
678 	 */
679 	Hasher.getHashQuery = function(){
680 		return _queryUtils.getQueryString( this.getHash() ).substr(1);
681 	};
682 	
683 	/**
684 	 * Get Query portion of the Hash as an Object
685 	 * - alias to: `millermedeiros.queryUtils.toQueryObject( Hasher.getHashQueryString() );`
686 	 * @return {Object} Hash Query
687 	 */
688 	Hasher.getHashQueryAsObject = function(){
689 		return _queryUtils.toQueryObject( this.getHashQuery() );
690 	};
691 	
692 	/**
693 	 * Get parameter value from the query portion of the Hash
694 	 * - alias to: `millermedeiros.queryUtils.getParamValue(paramName, Hasher.getHash() );`
695 	 * @param {string} paramName	Parameter Name.
696 	 * @return {string}	Parameter value.
697 	 */
698 	Hasher.getHashQueryParam = function(paramName){
699 		return _queryUtils.getParamValue(paramName, this.getHash() );
700 	};
701 	
702 	/**
703 	 * Set page title
704 	 * @param {string} value	Page Title
705 	 */
706 	Hasher.setTitle = function(value){
707 		document.title = value;
708 	};
709 	
710 	/**
711 	 * Get page title
712 	 * @return {string} Page Title
713 	 */
714 	Hasher.getTitle = function(){
715 		return document.title;
716 	};
717 	
718 	/**
719 	 * Navigate to previous page in history
720 	 */
721 	Hasher.back = function(){
722 		history.back();
723 	};
724 	
725 	/**
726 	 * Navigate to next page in history
727 	 */
728 	Hasher.forward = function(){
729 		history.forward();
730 	};
731 	
732 	/**
733 	 * Loads a page from the session history, identified by its relative location to the current page.
734 	 * - for example `-1` loads previous page, `1` loads next page.
735 	 * @param {int} delta	Relative location to the current page.
736 	 */
737 	Hasher.go = function(delta){
738 		history.go(delta);
739 	};
740 	
741 	/**
742 	 * Removes all event listeners, stops Hasher and destroy Hasher object.
743 	 * - IMPORTANT: Hasher won't work after calling this method, Hasher Object will be deleted.
744 	 */
745 	Hasher.dispose = function(){
746 		Hasher.removeAllEventListeners(true);
747 		Hasher.stop();
748 		_hash = _checkInterval = _isActive = _frame = UA  = _isIE = _isLegacyIE = _isHashChangeSupported = _isLocal = _queryUtils = _eventFacade = Hasher = window.Hasher = null;
749 		//can't use `delete window.hasher;` because on IE it throws errors, `window` isn't actually an object, delete can only be used on Object properties.
750 	};
751 	
752 	/**
753 	 * Returns string representation of the Hasher object.
754 	 * @return {string} A string representation of the object.
755 	 */
756 	Hasher.toString = function(){
757 		return '[Hasher version="'+ this.VERSION +'" hash="'+ this.getHash() +'"]';
758 	};
759 	
760 }(window, document, window.location, history));
761
